summary: An internal FBI email chain from September 2019 discussing victim services coordination for Jeffrey Epstein victims. It details meetings with six victims, contact with attorney Gloria Allred, and inquiries about victim compensation eligibility through the Office for Victims of Crime (OVS).

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney who took the FBI agent's business card and mentioned she has two more victims she will refer for services.

events.title: FBI Victim Services Coordination
events.description: FBI agent reports meeting with a total of 6 Epstein victims, providing them with support materials, assessing their needs, and discussing therapy options. Contact was made with their attorneys, including Gloria Allred.

events.title: Inquiry about Victim Compensation Eligibility
events.description: An email from the Office for Victims of Crime (OVS) states that victims could be eligible for compensation if a letter from a DA or AUSA is provided stating they would have prosecuted if the case had been brought timely.

keyFacts: FBI agents met with six victims of Jeffrey Epstein in September 2019 to provide victim services and support.
Attorney Gloria Allred was involved, indicating she had two more victims to refer to the FBI.
A victim in Lake Havasu was mentioned, having been told to go to Las Vegas for services, highlighting geographical challenges for victims.

The Office for Victims of Crime indicated victims might still apply for compensation if a prosecutor provided a letter stating they would have prosecuted the case if it had been brought in a timely manner.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination between New York, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C. offices regarding Epstein victim support.
